Key Match Events: The Cubs avoided the sweep with a 6-2 victory.
Veteran pitcher Kyle Hendricks showed he still has something left with a vintage quality start.
Rookie first baseman Michael Busch blasted two home runs.
Pre-Game Insights: Cubs manager Craig Counsell acknowledged the team's overall performance hasn't been good enough.
The Cubs' playoff odds had dropped to 0 percent by Sunday morning according to FanGraphs.
Baseball Reference model said there was a 0.4 percent chance for the Cubs to make the playoffs.
Post-Match Reflections: Cubs second baseman Nico Hoerner appreciated the group's ability to continue to make the most of the next day.
Cubs pitcher Jameson Taillon mentioned the team will keep their heads down and go to work despite the tough situation.
Rookie center fielder Pete Crow-Armstrong reflected on maintaining trust and making the next play.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cubs' playoff probability increased to 0.1 percent after the win.
The Cubs have not delivered a postseason win since 2017.
